177.article_body: Indian all-rounder Hardik Pandya said that he was always excited to come to Australia and get so much time to prepare for the T20 World Cup. "In Australia, it's about one inning. If you can get the inning early in the season, once you get used to the conditions, you can score a lot of runs," Pandya said.

178.title: US woman saves for 30 years to fund her ₹2 cr trip to see the Titanic's wreckage
178.article_body: An American woman named Renata Rojas saved money for over 30 years to fund her trip to see the wreckage of the Titanic ship which sank in 1912. Renata spent $250,000 (around ₹2 crore) for the trip to the bottom of the North Atlantic Ocean to see the remains of the ship which sank 110 years ago.

179.title: Samantha Ruth Prabhu's 'Yashoda' to release on November 11
179.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu on Monday announced the release date of her movie 'Yashoda'. The film will be released on November 11. It will arrive in theatres in multiple languages, including Telugu, Tamil, Malayalam, Kannada and Hindi. 'Yashoda' has been directed by Haresh Narayan and K Hari Shankar.

180.title: No Kejriwal to tutor Sisodia during CBI questioning: Amit Malviya
180.article_body: BJP leader Amit Malviya said Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia needs to be reminded that "he has been summoned for corruption and is not going for Satyagrah". Malviya added that Sisodia has to face the CBI alone and "there will be no Kejriwal to tutor" him. He said Rahul Gandhi too had thrown "similar tantrums" but still recorded his statements.

181.title: You gave me company when I faced a tough time as child: Arjun to Sanjay Kapoor
181.article_body: Arjun Kapoor took to Instagram on Monday to wish his uncle Sanjay Kapoor on the occasion of his birthday. In a video message, Arjun said, "You've given me company when I faced a tough time as...child." "I...want to thank you from the bottom of my heart, for being such a positive person, who's so full of life," he added.

182.title: Germany fines Telegram $5 mn for not establishing way to report content
182.article_body: Telegram has been fined $5 million by Germany for not establishing a lawful way for reporting illegal content and not naming an entity in Germany to receive official communication. Officials said they've repeatedly failed in their attempts to serve papers to Dubai-based Telegram, despite support from UAE authorities. Telegram is becoming "medium for radicalisation", German police had said earlier.

183.title: Fill up 14 lakh vacant posts in govt depts, PSUs: CPI to Centre
183.article_body: The Communist Party of India has demanded that the Centre immediately fill about 14 lakh vacant posts in the Central government departments and the public sector undertakings. In a resolution passed at its 24th national congress at Vijayawada on Monday, the CPI alleged that over two crore youths of the country are unemployed and seeking jobs.

184.title: Govt to invite proposals under second phase of PLI scheme for solar sector
184.article_body: New & Renewable Energy Secretary Indu Shekhar Chaturvedi said government will invite proposals under second phase of ₹19,500-crore production linked incentive (PLI-II) scheme for solar sector within a week. Chaturvedi added that by 2026, India is looking at the capacities of 38 GW in Polysilicons, 56 GW in Ingot and Wafers, 70-80 GW in cells and 90-100 GW in modules.

185.title: We need to wake up: WI head coach Simmons on team's loss vs Scotland
185.article_body: West Indies head coach Phil Simmons said his side's batting was "a bit unprofessional" in their 42-run defeat against Scotland in T20 World Cup 2022. "We need to wake up...start being as professional as we can be," he added. Chasing 161, West Indies were bowled out for 118 in 18.3 overs as only four of their batters reached double digits.

186.title: Indian cyclist Ronaldo creates national record in 200m flying time trial
186.article_body: Indian cyclist Ronaldo Singh Laitonjam created a new national record in men's 200m flying time trial category in the recently concluded Cycling Track World Championships 2022 in France. He clocked 9.91 seconds in the men's sprint qualifying round. Finishing at the 31st place, Ronaldo couldn't qualify as only the top 28 made it to the next round.

187.title: Was asked to leave AAP: Delhi Deputy CM Sisodia after 9-hour CBI questioning
187.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, who was questioned by CBI in Delhi excise policy scam case for nearly nine hours on Monday, said, "I was asked to leave AAP or else such cases will keep getting registered against me." He added, "I said I won't leave AAP for BJP." Sisodia alleged he was told that he'll be made the CM.

188.title: Beauty: Anushka on Kohli's 1-handed catch vs Aus in T20 WC warm-up match
188.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma took to Instagram Stories and reacted to her husband and cricketer Virat Kohli taking a one-handed catch versus Australia during the T20 World Cup warm-up match. Sharing the video of the catch, the actress wrote, "Beauty!" Australia lost by six runs in the warm-up match after India took four wickets in the last four deliveries.

189.title: EU approves training mission for Ukrainian soldiers
189.article_body: The European Union (EU) on Monday approved a military assistance mission to train 15,000 Ukrainian soldiers in the wake of the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. The mission will initially run for two years with a budget of almost $104 million, the Associated Press reported. The bloc also approved military aid worth $486 million for the purchase of weapons by Kyiv.

190.title: Cement maker ACC posts loss of ₹91 crore in Q3; sales grow 7%
190.article_body: Cement manufacturer ACC has reported a standalone loss of ₹91 crore for the quarter ended September 2022. The company recorded a 7% rise in net sales at ₹3,910 crore as compared to ₹3,653 crore it reported in the same quarter last year. Notably, Gautam Adani-led Adani Group has recently acquired ACC along with Ambuja Cements from Switzerland's Holcim.

191.title: Gavaskar gifts Babar 'Sunny' cap at dinner party hosted by Hayden, PCB shares video
191.article_body: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) shared a video showing Sunil Gavaskar meeting Pakistan captain Babar Azam at a dinner party hosted by Pakistan's batting mentor Matthew Hayden at his house in Brisbane. In the video, Gavaskar can be seen presenting 'Sunny' cap to Babar. He can also be seen signing the cap for Babar.

192.title: Katrina Kaif to play double role in 'Phone Bhoot': Reports
192.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif will reportedly be seen in a double role in the upcoming film 'Phone Bhoot'. Directed by Gurmmeet Singh, it is a horror-comedy film which will also feature Ishaan Khatter, Siddhant Chaturvedi, Jackie Shroff and Sheeba Chadha, among others. 'Phone Bhoot' is set to release in theatres on November 4.

193.title: 2 UN peacekeepers killed, 4 injured in IED blast in Mali
193.article_body: Two UN peacekeepers were killed and four were seriously injured when their vehicle hit an IED in northern Mali on Monday, UN peacekeeping mission MINUSMA said. The peacekeepers were on a mine detection patrol in the Kidal region when the incident occurred, MINUSMA added. Northern Mali has a strong presence of militant groups linked to al-Qaeda and the Islamic State.

194.title: Video of Babar, Kohli practising in parallel nets in Brisbane goes viral
194.article_body: A video of Pakistan captain Babar Azam and former India captain Virat Kohli practising in parallel nets in Brisbane ahead of T20 World Cup 2022 has gone viral. Kohli went straight into the nets after India's victory against Australia in their warm-up match. Kohli scored 19 runs off 13 deliveries in the match, including a four and a six.

195.title: Tina Datta was trying to backstab me on 'Bigg Boss 16': Sreejita De
195.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 16' contestant Sreejita De, who became the first contestant to be evicted from the show, has said that co-contestant and actress Tina Datta was trying to backstab her on the show. "Now that I'm out, I get to see that she...was trying to manipulate her friends against me...She was talking bad about me behind my back," Sreejita added.

196.title: Liverpool pledge to impose life ban on fans who threw coins at Guardiola
196.article_body: Liverpool FC have pledged to impose life ban on the club's supporters found guilty of throwing coins towards Pep Guardiola during Sunday's Premier League match against Manchester City at Anfield. "This is totally unacceptable behaviour and not the standards of behaviour we expect at Anfield," said a club spokesman. Guardiola had said he did not get hit by the coins.

197.title: Deepika in talks to star in Rajamouli's next film with Mahesh Babu: Reports
197.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone is reportedly in talks to play the female lead in filmmaker SS Rajamouli's next film, which will feature Mahesh Babu as the male lead. The yet-untitled film will reportedly go on the floors in the first half of 2023. Deepika will also be seen in 'Pathaan', 'Fighter', 'Project K' and 'The Intern'.

198.title: Karnataka High Court stays counselling for NEET PG 2022
198.article_body: The Karnataka High Court on Monday stayed the counselling process for NEET Postgraduate Entrance Test (PGET) 2022 till further notice. Details about the commencement of the Karnataka counselling will be announced soon and the Karnataka High Court will hear the matter now on October 30. Registrations for the counselling began on October 14.

199.title: Hrithik delayed 'Vikram Vedha' shoot for me due to 'Mismatched 2': Rohit Saraf
199.article_body: 'Vikram Vedha' actor Rohit Saraf said Hrithik Roshan intervened after the shoot dates of the film and Rohit's web series 'Mismatched 2' were clashing. He added 'Mismatched' director Akarsh Khurana adjusted shoot dates after a talk with Hrithik. "But...Hrithik understood we couldn't cancel...schedule of 'Mismatched'...entire schedule of 'Vikram Vedha' got pushed by five days," Rohit stated.

200.title: 11 convicts in Bilkis Bano case granted bail for good behaviour: Guj govt to SC
200.article_body: The 11 men convicted in the Bilkis Bano gang-rape case were released on grounds of "good behaviour", the Gujarat government told the Supreme Court on Monday. The state government has filed an affidavit defending its decision to grant remission to the convicts, who were sentenced to life imprisonment. Bilkis' three-year-old daughter was among 14 killed by a mob in 2002.

201.title: Bitterly disappointed: Balbirnie after Ireland's loss vs Zimbabwe in T20 WC
201.article_body: Ireland skipper Andy Balbirnie said his side is "bitterly disappointed" with the way they started their T20 World Cup 2022 campaign after losing to Zimbabwe by 31 runs in Group B match on Monday. "It's a pretty straightforward shoot-out for us now," he added. Chasing a target of 175 runs, Ireland managed to score 143/9 in 20 overs.

202.title: Qatar World Cup ticket sales near 3 million mark: FIFA President
202.article_body: FIFA President Gianni Infantino said that 2.89 million tickets have been sold up till now for the upcoming football World Cup in Qatar and the figure is soon likely to touch the three million mark. Almost 240,000 hospitality packages had been sold for the tournament, Infantino said. The top three purchasing countries are Qatar, the United States and Saudi Arabia.

203.title: Wild bear sighted near T'gana university campus, search op underway
203.article_body: Telangana Forest Department officials have started a search operation to locate a wild bear that was reportedly sighted near the men's hostel of Satavahana University in Telangana's Karimnagar on Sunday night. Meanwhile, students have reportedly been asked not to venture out in the evenings. The campus security guards who keep vigil at night have been asked to move in groups.

204.title: India's retail inflation set to ease from 5-month high in September: RBI
204.article_body: The RBI, in its monthly bulletin, said that retail inflation is set to ease after it hit a five-month high in September. RBI added that the fight against inflation will be "dogged and prolonged", given the long and variable lags of monetary policies. It said the expected easing in inflation would likely be "driven by the food and beverages".

205.title: Flights rescheduled as Mumbai airport to remain closed between 11 am & 5 pm tomorrow
205.article_body: Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport will be closed between 11 am and 5 pm on Tuesday due to annual repair and maintenance work on both its runways. The airport has rescheduled flights accordingly. Major work like runway edge lights and the upgradation of Aeronautical ground lights will be carried out during this time period.

206.title: Raza played exceptionally well: Ervine on Zimbabwe's win vs Ireland in T20 WC
206.article_body: Zimbabwe skipper Craig Ervine lauded Sikandar Raza, saying his teammate played exceptionally well against Ireland in T20 World Cup 2022 Group B match. "He's been a solid performer for us over the last few months. So excited that he could bring that form here again," he added. Raza was adjudged 'Player of the Match' in Zimbabwe's 31-run win.

207.title: Apple's VR headset to let users log in, make payments biometrically: Report
207.article_body: Apple's virtual reality XR headset will include sensors that work like Face ID and offer iris-scanning technology, according to reports. The new technology, called 'Iris ID', would enable users to log in to their accounts and make payments biometrically. The headset reportedly has over 10 cameras and might be powered by M2 chip, same as that used in MacBook Air.

208.title: RBI fines 3 Gujarat-based cooperative banks for rule violations
208.article_body: RBI has fined three Gujarat-based banks for violating regulatory norms. RBI has reportedly imposed a monetary penalty of ₹25,000 on Meghraj Nagarik Sahakari Bank, ₹50,000 on Gandhidham Mercantile Co-operative Bank and ₹2 lakh on Co-operative Bank of Rajkot. The banks had individually sanctioned loans, wherein directors' relatives stood as surety or guarantors, violating RBI's regulatory norms.

209.title: Makers share pic from 'Pushpa 2' sets, Rashmika Mandanna reacts
209.article_body: Mythri Movie Makers, the producers of Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna's 'Pushpa' franchise, shared a picture from the sets of 'Pushpa: The Rule' on Twitter. Along with the picture, they tweeted, "Icon star Allu, director Sukumar, celebrity photographer Avinash Gowariker...the entire team is putting all their efforts to deliver the best." Rashmika tweeted, "Look at that! It's starting y'all."

210.title: Hacker who stole $100 mn from DeFi app Mango gets to keep $50 mn
210.article_body: A hacker who stole about $100 million from decentralised-finance (DeFi) application Mango got to keep around $50 million of the funds in various crypto assets after returning the rest on Saturday. The hacker had demanded erasure of bad debts. Mango's team then offered to let the hacker keep $50 million while promising no criminal prosecution and erasure of bad debt.

211.title: Beating Magnus Carlsen is special, but not very proud of that game: 16-year-old Gukesh D
211.article_body: After 16-year-old Grandmaster Gukesh D became the youngest chess player to defeat Magnus Carlsen after the latter became world champion, Gukesh said, "Beating Magnus is always special...but I am not very proud of that game." Carlsen said, "Gukesh has been extremely impressive in classical chess...Perhaps this rapid win wasn't his proudest effort, even though getting a win is always nice."

212.title: 4 more terror suspects with links to al-Qaeda arrested in Assam
212.article_body: Assam Police on Monday arrested four persons with alleged links to Ansarullah Bangla Team (ABT), a Bangladesh-based terror outfit affiliated with al-Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent. CM Himanta Biswa Sarma, announcing the arrests, said, "We're determined to root out jihadi elements from Assam." "Arrest of Sadeq Ali is a significant achievement since he had been radicalising youth," he added.

213.title: Journalist who protested Ukraine war on live TV flees Russia
213.article_body: Former Russian state TV journalist Marina Ovsyannikova, who was placed under house arrest for spreading "fake news" about the war in Ukraine, has fled the country, her lawyer said on Monday. Ovsyannikova announced her escape from house arrest in an online post on October 5. She had staged an on-air protest against Russia's invasion of Ukraine in March.

214.title: Afghan woman kills self before Taliban could stone her for eloping with married man
214.article_body: An Afghan woman, who was to be stoned to death by the Taliban for running away with a married man, died by suicide to reportedly avoid public humiliation, local media said. The man she ran away with was reportedly executed on Thursday. The woman was sentenced to be publicly stoned due to the lack of women's prisons, said a report.

215.title: Vegetable seller objects to man drinking alcohol in Agra, stabbed
215.article_body: A 32-year-old vegetable vendor was stabbed to death in Agra after he objected to a man drinking alcohol near his cart, police said on Monday. The 26-year-old accused took a sharp object from the cart and stabbed the vendor in his chest on Sunday, police said. The victim was taken to the hospital but was declared dead later, police added.

216.title: Trolls, where are you all slowly vanishing, don't leave me: Raj Kundra
216.article_body: Shilpa Shetty's husband Raj Kundra tweeted, "Trolls, where are you all slowly vanishing, please don't leave me." Recently, Raj completed one year of being released from jail in connection with the alleged creation and uploading of porn films on apps. Several Twitter users reacted to Raj's post. One of the users wrote, "This tweet is also going to be deleted."

217.title: Politician Shrikant Tyagi, who abused & assaulted Noida woman, gets bail
217.article_body: The Allahabad High Court has granted bail to politician Shrikant Tyagi, who assaulted a woman at a Noida residential society in August. Tyagi was granted bail in some cases but remained in jail. Among other cases, he was booked under the Gangster Act after a group of his supporters stormed the society and sought the woman complainant's address.

218.title: A small film is breaking records of biggies: RGV on 'Kantara'
218.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took to Twitter to praise Rishab Shetty's film 'Kantara'. "Just when all filmwallas came to the conclusion that only superstars, massive production values and spectacular VFX can bring people to theatres, a small tiny film with no names, #Kantara is breaking all...records of the biggies," he wrote. The film has collected over ₹100 crore globally.

219.title: Suryakumar is very different from Kohli and Karthik: Gambhir
219.article_body: Speaking about Suryakumar Yadav, Gautam Gambhir stated that the Team India batter is very different from teammates Virat Kohli and Dinesh Karthik. "He (Suryakumar) is extremely unorthodox, plays shots over fine leg, third man, cover...Karthik...improvises a lot...Kohli likes to take his time while batting," he added. Suryakumar scored a 33-ball 50 against Australia in T20 World Cup warm-up match.

220.title: Kerala human sacrifice accused may have used mortuary experience: Police
220.article_body: The key accused of torturing and killing two women as 'human sacrifice' in Kerala may have used his mortuary experience to cut the bodies, police said. The accused had worked as a helper at the post-mortem table around 20 years ago. The women were killed on different days between June and September.

221.title: Deeply concerning: UK on attack on protester at Chinese consulate
221.article_body: The British PM's office on Monday said the reports of an apparent assault on a protester inside the grounds of the Chinese consulate in Manchester were "deeply concerning". The protester was seemingly dragged into the consular grounds and assaulted by several men, according to a video shared online. The incident occurred during a demonstration against Chinese President Xi Jinping.

222.title: Ladakh administration gifts cricket kit to young Virat Kohli fan after her video goes viral
222.article_body: The Ladakh administration gifted a cricket kit to a Class 6 girl named Masuma Banoo from Kaksar Kargil after her video playing cricket went viral on social media. In the video, the girl had stated that Virat Kohli is her favourite cricketer and she wants to bat like him. The administration also shared a video wherein Masuma expressed her gratitude.

223.title: She is & will always be the most beautiful actress: Bhansali on Hema Malini
223.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said in an interview that he is a huge fan of Hema Malini, adding that she is and will always be "the most beautiful actress ever". "[Earlier] movies were bought by distributors solely because of her presence," he said. "It didn't matter who the hero was if Hemaji was in a film," Bhansali further said.

224.title: Salman Khan, Anil Kapoor & Fardeen Khan's 'No Entry 2' shelved: Reports
224.article_body: Salman Khan-starrer 'No Entry 2' has reportedly been shelved over legal and financial issues. According to a source, the plan was to pay off everyone and acquire the rights to the 2005 film, which was produced by now-closed Sahara One Motion Pictures. However, the amount has reportedly exceeded the budget. "Circumstances are such that nothing is materializing," the source added.

225.title: Woman fights robbers, foils robbery attempt in Raj; video surfaces
225.article_body: In a video that has now gone viral, a female Gramin Bank employee can be seen fighting robbers and thwarting a robbery bid in Rajasthan's Sri Ganganagar area. The robber allegedly barged into the bank with a knife and threatened the officials. In the video, the woman can be seen picking up an electrical instrument to fight the robbers.

226.title: Justice DY Chandrachud appointed Chief Justice of India from November 9 onward
226.article_body: Justice DY Chandrachud was on Monday appointed the 50th Chief Justice of India (CJI) by President Droupadi Murmu, Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said. Chandrachud, a law graduate from Delhi University, will take oath on November 9. The current Justice UU Lalit, who is due to retire on November 8, recommended Chandrachud as his successor last week.

227.title: 5 including 4 of Haryana family dead, 3 hurt in car-truck collision
227.article_body: Four members of a family died after the car they were travelling in collided head-on with a truck coming from the opposite direction in Haryana's Hisar district, police said on Monday. Because of the collision, two motorcycles were also hit and one of the riders died, police added. At least three persons sustained injuries in the accident.

228.title: MP doctor writes prescription in Hindi with 'Shri Hari', pics surface
228.article_body: A prescription written in Hindi by a government doctor in Madhya Pradesh has surfaced on social media. The doctor, Sarvesh Singh, also wrote 'Shri Hari' on the top of the prescription. This comes after Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that doctors could perhaps start writing prescriptions in Hindi with 'Shri Hari' on top.

229.title: Without late director Nishikant, Drishyam 2 wasn't possible: Ajay Devgn
229.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn remembered late director Nishikant Kamat, who had directed 'Drishyam', at the trailer launch event of 'Drishyam 2'. "I want to just take this occasion to remember Nishi, who directed the first part. Without him, this wasn't possible," he stated. Nishikant, who was diagnosed with cirrhosis, passed away aged 50 in 2020.

230.title: AAP 'glorifying' corruption, says BJP after Sisodia's 'roadshow'
230.article_body: BJP on Monday accused AAP of "glorifying corruption", alleging that Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia held a roadshow despite being complicit in the excise policy scam. BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said he was hurt when he saw Sisodia being garlanded and being taken to Rajghat in an open car. AAP converting a vice into a victory, Patra said.

231.title: 3 J'khand teenagers die, another hurt as portion of land caves in
231.article_body: Three teenagers died after a portion of land caved in when they were extracting soil for painting their hut's walls for Diwali in Jharkhand's Chatra district, police said. Four teenagers, who were left buried after the incident, were retrieved with the help of villagers and an excavator. They were rushed to a health sub-centre, where three of them died.

232.title: Here to be serious actress, not girl who only does dance numbers: AvrRam
232.article_body: Actress Elli AvrRam, speaking about being an outsider and a foreigner in the film industry, said she's in a "constant struggle" to prove she's a serious actress, not the girl who only does dance numbers. "But I'm happy where I'm today and I'm really grateful to all the people who gave me an opportunity to showcase my talent," she added.

233.title: You'll not see this sort of batting in every game: Gambhir on KL Rahul's 57
233.article_body: Praising KL Rahul following his 33-ball 57 in India's T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up match against Australia, Gautam Gambhir said, "You will not see this sort of batting in every match." He added that Rahul, who hit six fours and three sixes during his knock, was seen in "exceptional" rhythm. India won the match by six runs.

234.title: Delhi LG issues notice to DDC VC Jasmine Shah over misuse of public office
234.article_body: Delhi LG VK Saxena on Monday issued a show cause notice to Dialogue and Development Commission's Vice Chairperson Jasmine Shah over allegations of "misuse of public office". The notice has been sent following a complaint by BJP MP Parvesh Sahib Singh. "Shah...acted as official spokesperson of AAP for political gains, which is in violation of established procedures," LG's notice read.

235.title: 2 Chinese nationals arrested for cyber fraud in Greater Noida
235.article_body: Two Chinese nationals were arrested in Greater Noida for their alleged involvement in cyber fraud. The accused, Feng Chenjin and Huang Kuan, had put out an app through which they lured Indian citizens into making easy money online and later cheated them, police said. Over 150 SIM cards, two laptops and ₹30,000 cash, among others were recovered from the accused.

236.title: It's special win for us: Berrington on Scotland's win vs WI in T20 WC
236.article_body: After Scotland's 42-run win against West Indies in Group B match in T20 World Cup 2022,  Scotland skipper Richard Berrington said, "It's a special win for us." He added, "A lot of hard work has been put in for this in...last one year. Extremely proud of the boys." Chasing 161, West Indies were bowled out for 118 in 18.3 overs.

237.title: Boy dies after teacher thrashes him for failing a test in Greater Noida
237.article_body: A school teacher in Greater Noida has been arrested for allegedly thrashing a 12-year-old student. Police said the boy was beaten because he had failed a test. The child died of internal bleeding in the brain, although there are no antemortem injuries that would have directly caused it, the boy's post-mortem report said.

238.title: Centre suspends IAS officer Narain accused of raping woman in Andaman & Nicobar
238.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has suspended 1990-batch IAS officer of AGMUT Cadre Jitendra Narain for the alleged rape of a woman in Andaman and Nicobar Islands, said an official. The government received a report on the alleged sexual assault, said MHA official Ashutosh Agnihotri. The report indicated "grave misconduct and misuse of official position" by Narain, he said.

239.title: SC rejects Kerala's plea against leasing Thiruvananthapuram airport to Adani
239.article_body: Supreme Court has dismissed the Kerala government's plea challenging the handover of the operations of the Thiruvananthapuram International Airport to Adani Enterprises Limited. The Airport Authority of India has allowed the Adani Group to operate, manage and develop the airport for 50 years. The airport was handed over to the group in October last year.

240.title: The fight against inflation will be dogged and prolonged: RBI
240.article_body: The RBI, in its October bulletin, said, "The fight against inflation will be dogged and prolonged, given the long and variable lags with which monetary policy operates, and fraught with uncertainties." Inflation has been above the Monetary Policy Committee's 2%-6% target band for three consecutive quarters. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) rose to 7.41% in September from 7% in August.

241.title: A vehicle is stolen every 12 mins in NCR: Report
241.article_body: According to a report by ACKO, vehicle theft accounts for nearly 20% of total crimes reported in Delhi-NCR, translating to about a vehicle theft every 12 minutes. According to the report, the areas most prone to vehicle theft are Rohini, Bhajanpura, Uttam Nagar, Sector 12 Noida, Gurugram and Sultanpuri. Popular cars like Wagon-R and Swift Dzire are stolen the most.

242.title: Good actors bring out the best in you: Ajay on working with Akshaye Khanna
242.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn, sharing his experience of working with Akshaye Khanna in 'Drishyam 2', said, "It is always great to work with a good actor because good actors bring out the best in you also." The duo previously worked together in 'Deewangee', a crime-drama film which was released in 2002. 'Drishyam 2' is set to release on November 18.

243.title: Batting was disappointing: WI skipper Pooran after loss to Scotland
243.article_body: Following his side's 42-run loss to Scotland in the T20 World Cup round one game, West Indies skipper Nicholas Pooran said that their batting was disappointing after the powerplay overs. "We got to do the hard work now...160 was a par score. The middle-order batting was disappointing. The ball was not spinning much. We got to reflect," Pooran said.

244.title: Tenders issued for construction of 4 flyovers between Hebbal, Basaveshwara Circle
244.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on Sunday issued tenders for construction of flyovers over four intersections between Basaveshwara Circle and Hebbal. The tenders were issued for consultancy services to prepare a feasibility report and Detailed Project Report. The report will also study feasibility of building a single, long flyover, said BBMP chief Tushar Giri Nath.

245.title: 2-year-old girl raped and thrown near railway tracks in Ghaziabad
245.article_body: A two-year-old girl was raped by an unidentified man and later thrown near railway tracks in Ghaziabad. The girl was missing since Friday, said Gyanendra Singh, Additional SP (city-2), adding that the victim's mother is mentally disturbed and begs for a living. The matter was reported by a local on Saturday and the police have detained five people for questioning.

246.title: More than 600 people dead, 1.3 mn displaced in flood-hit Nigeria
246.article_body: The death toll from the recent flooding in Nigeria has crossed the 600-mark, the government informed on Sunday. The disaster has forced more than 1.3 million people to abandon their homes, according to Nigeria's ministry of humanitarian affairs. The flooding also completely destroyed over 82,000 houses and around 2,72,000 acres of farmland, the minister added.

247.title: Shalin Bhanot is fake, Gori Nagori is toxic: Bigg Boss 16's Sreejita
247.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 16' contestant Sreejita De, who was recently evicted from the show, called her co-contestants Shalin Bhanot and Gori Nagori "fake" and "toxic", respectively. "Shalin has a lot of unnecessary attitude problems and a superiority complex," Sreejita stated. Speaking about Gori, Sreejita said, "I don't share a healthy equation with her...I wouldn't want to stay around such people."

248.title: Anil shares old pics of brother Sanjay Kapoor on his b'day, pens note
248.article_body: Anil Kapoor wished actor-brother Sanjay Kapoor on his birthday via an Instagram post on Monday. Sharing some old pictures of his brother, Anil wrote, "I admire your spirit, humour, never die attitude, the way you look after and love our mother and your family." "I truly believe...60 is just the beginning of even more wonderful decades for you," Anil added.

249.title: Man found murdered with head, hand chopped off in Pune, 3 arrested
249.article_body: Pune Police have arrested three persons after a 28-year-old man was found murdered in the Velha taluka of the Pune district. Police had discovered the man's decomposing body on October 12. The head and the left hand of the body were found chopped off. Police have identified the deceased as Rahul Prakash Rawat, a resident of Indrayani Nagar in Bhosari.

250.title: Voting trend shows Kharge is favourite: Ex-Tamil Nadu Cong chief
250.article_body: On the day of voting for the Congress Presidential polls, former chief of the party's Tamil Nadu unit Su Thirunavukkarasar said that the "voting trend shows Mallikarjun Kharge is the favourite". "Elections are held transparently and there's nothing wrong with Shashi Tharoor's candidature. People can vote for whomever they want since elections are held within the party," Thirunavukkarasar said.

251.title: Scooter-borne woman run over by bus after tipping over pothole in B'luru
251.article_body: A 50-year-old scooter-borne woman was run over by a Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation bus in Bengaluru's Rajajinagar on Monday after her two-wheeler skidded upon falling in a pothole. The woman, who was travelling with her daughter, was critically injured and was shifted to the hospital. "Only after a probe, we'll...know the cause," said BBMP Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath.

252.title: Actress Vaishali Takkar's neighbours booked for abetment in her suicide
252.article_body: A day after actress Vaishali Takkar allegedly died by suicide in Indore, Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said police have filed a case of abetment of suicide against her neighbour Rahul Navlani and his wife Disha. "A five-page suicide note was found at the spot in which Vaishali named Rahul for harassing her," ACP Motiur Rahman said.

253.title: Mumbai woman struggles for 28 yrs to get property docs, NHRC files case
253.article_body: NHRC has reportedly registered a case after a Mumbai-based widow struggled for 28 years to get her original property documents from a registration office. Citizens Vigilance Forum President Kashyap M Vyas said that due to the absence of these documents, the family is unable to sell/gift the property. CVF had written to PM Narendra Modi and NHRC over the matter.

254.title: Delhi Police arrest 4 members of 'Thak Thak' gang
254.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested four members of 'Thak Thak' gang, who knock on car windows to distract people's attention to rob them. With these arrests, police have reportedly solved four theft cases and recovered four stolen laptops from their possession. The accused are aged between 24-54 years and one of them has worked as a 'junior artist' in Tamil films.

255.title: Russian drones hit sunflower oil tanks in Mykolaiv: Ukraine
255.article_body: Three Russian "kamikaze" drones hit sunflower oil storage tanks in the Ukrainian port city of Mykolaiv late on Sunday, causing the tanks to go up in flames, the city mayor said on Monday. The attack took place hours before suspected Iranian-made drones allegedly launched by Russian forces struck the capital Kyiv. Mykolaiv has been under constant shelling in recent months.

256.title: NTPC, Mitsubishi sign MoU to demonstrate hydrogen co-firing with natural gas
256.article_body: NTPC signed an MoU with Japan's Mitsubishi Heavy Industries and its subsidiary Mitsubishi Power India Private Limited to demonstrate the feasibility of hydrogen co-firing blended with natural gas in MHI 701D gas turbines. The turbines are installed at NTPC's Auraiya Gas Power Plant in Uttar Pradesh. The total installed capacity of the Auraiya Gas Power Plant is 663 MW.

257.title: JP Morgan announces multiple major role changes for India division
257.article_body: JP Morgan India announced a major internal rejig of roles with former Reliance Industries mergers and acquisitions head Navin Wadhwani being appointed as the new investment banking chief. Kaustubh Kulkarni replaced Madhav Kalyan as the Senior Country Officer (SCO) for India. Kalyan has been appointed as head of Asia Pacific Payments, succeeding Sridhar Kanthadai.

258.title: Village head hires man to poison 18 stray dogs to death in Andhra; 3 arrested
258.article_body: The head of Chebrole village in Andhra Pradesh's Eluru district and two others were arrested for allegedly poisoning 18 stray dogs and killing them. The sarpanch allegedly gave an informal contract to a man to poison the dogs and he was promised ₹300 for every dog that he killed. All three accused were released on bail later.

259.title: BFI appoints ex-Irish boxer Dunne as India's High Performance Director
259.article_body: Ex-Irish boxer Bernard Dunne has been appointed as High Performance Director for Indian boxing, announced Boxing Federation of India (BFI). The 42-year-old was in charge of the Irish boxing team from 2017 to 2022 and helped the boxers win European, world and Olympic gold medals. "India has huge boxing talent and its boxers have been performing exceedingly well," said Dunne.

260.title: Remove Shah Rukh & make Ganguly ambassador of WB: BJP to Mamata over BCCI remark
260.article_body: The Leader of Opposition in the Bengal Assembly and BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari criticised West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee over her appeal to PM Narendra Modi to let BCCI President Sourav Ganguly contest the ICC elections. "Remove Shah Rukh Khan and make Sourav Ganguly the brand ambassador of West Bengal," Adhikari said, adding PM Modi stays out of such things.

261.title: Hetero buys J&J's manufacturing unit in Telangana for ₹130 crore: Report
261.article_body: Pharmaceuticals firm Hetero has acquired Johnson & Johnson's manufacturing plant at Penjerla in Telangana for a reported sum of ₹130 crore. The company said it will invest additional ₹600 crore on its upgradation. Hetero, in its statement, added that the facility will be Hetero's flagship sterile pharmaceutical and biologics manufacturing unit and will generate 2,000 new jobs.

262.title: Akhilesh Yadav immerses ashes of father Mulayam Singh in Haridwar; SP shares pics
262.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Monday immersed the ashes of his father, SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, in the Ganga river in Uttarakhand's Haridwar. He was accompanied by his wife Dimple Yadav and other relatives. Mulayam Singh passed away at Medanta Hospital in Gurugram after a prolonged illness last week.

263.title: Hardik's reaction after missing Mitchell Starc's delivery caught on stump mic, video viral
263.article_body: Hardik Pandya's reaction after missing a Mitchell Starc delivery during India-Australia T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up match was caught on stump mic. A video of the same has gone viral on social media. In the video, Hardik can be heard saying, "Mujhe pata hi nahi chala. Kab aaya, kab beat hua. Pata hi nahi chala."

264.title: Shocked at Ganguly's removal as BCCI chief, urge PM to ensure he contests ICC polls: Mamata
264.article_body: Reacting to Sourav Ganguly not getting another term as BCCI President, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said, "He's been deprived. What is his fault? I am very sad. I am really shocked." She added, "Why was he excluded in such an unfair way?" She further urged PM Narendra Modi to ensure Ganguly is allowed to contests ICC elections.

265.title: Ayushmann & Rakul-starrer 'Doctor G' collects ₹15 cr on opening weekend
265.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana, Rakul Preet Singh and Shefali Shah-starrer 'Doctor G' has earned over ₹15 crore at the domestic box office within three days of its release. The film, directed by Anubhuti Kashyap, earned ₹3.87 crore, ₹5.22 crore and ₹5.94 crore on Friday, Saturday and Sunday respectively, as per film trade analyst Taran Adarsh.

266.title: 18-month-old girl falls into bucket full of water in Chennai, dies
266.article_body: An 18-month-old girl allegedly died after she fell into a bucket full of water at her house in Tamil Nadu's Chennai. The girl's mother was outside the house, while her father had gone to work when the incident took place on Saturday. Meanwhile, police have registered a case into the matter and have sent the deceased girl's body for postmortem.

267.title: 5-star hotel manager in Rajasthan assaults wife for not playing 'wife swap' game, booked
267.article_body: A five-star hotel manager in Bikaner was booked for allegedly assaulting his wife for months and having unnatural sex with her for not being part of a 'wife swap' game. She said, "Drinking alcohol, taking drugs, having physical relations with different girls, and even having sex with boys was normal for him." She added that her in-laws demanded ₹50 lakh.

268.title: You've to lie a lot: Saif Ali Khan on why he's not on social media
268.article_body: Saif Ali Khan was asked about his absence from social media on 'The Kapil Sharma Show'. To this, Saif replied he was unable to find a handle in his name. Kapil said there's too much tension on such platforms. "I feel the same. You've to lie a lot...I do lie. But you can get stuck on social media," Saif replied.

269.title: 85-86% of Russian drones involved in latest attacks shot down: Kyiv
269.article_body: Ukrainian forces have shot down 37 Russian drones, which account for nearly 85-86% of the number involved in attacks, since Sunday evening, Ukraine's air force spokesperson Yuriy Ihnat said on Monday. "That's quite a good result for the work of our air defences," he stated. All the drones had flown into Ukraine from the south, the official added.

270.title: How was your experience in Delhi: MCD asks people to share perception
270.article_body: Under the 'My City My Pride' campaign, the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) is asking citizens to share their experiences of the national capital. MCD has shared a QR code for the citizens to take part in the Ease of Living (EOL) 2022 citizen perception survey about the city. MCD has also shared a video of a poem about Delhi.

271.title: Two Mumbai policemen arrested for extorting ₹10,000 from merchant
271.article_body: An assistant sub-inspector and a constable have been arrested for allegedly extorting ₹10,000 from a diamond merchant by threatening to file an FIR against him. The officers, posted at Mumbai's Sir JJ Marg Police Station, reportedly stopped the victim's car and forced him into a police van where they threatened him. The merchant later narrated the incident on Twitter.

272.title: China's state banks swapping yuan for USD to stabilise yuan: Report
272.article_body: China's state banks sold high volume of dollars, swapped yuan for dollars in forwards market and sold those dollars in the spot market on Monday, Reuters reported. The selling is likely aimed at stabilising yuan, which is down 11.6% against USD this year. State banks' trades appeared to be managed to ensure China's foreign reserves aren't used for this operation.

273.title: KSRTC to run 1,500 special buses during Diwali in Karnataka
273.article_body: The Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) has decided to run 1,500 special buses from October 21 to October 30 to cater to the rush of commuters during Diwali. According to the KSRTC, these buses will operate exclusively from Bengaluru's Kempegowda bus station. The KSRTC is expecting increased passenger loads, especially to and from Bengaluru.

274.title: No reports of sexual harassment: Miranda House Principal on fest incident
274.article_body: No incidents of sexual harassment have been reported from DU's Miranda House, the college's Principal said on Monday, after unknown men attempted to enter the college during a Diwali fest last week. Earlier, students took to social media and shared videos of a few men scaling the college's boundary wall, roaming around on the campus and raising slogans.

275.title: It'll bring big positive change: PM on launch of Hindi MBBS books
275.article_body: After the Hindi version of MBBS books was launched in Madhya Pradesh, PM Narendra Modi said, "This beginning in the field of medical education is going to bring a big positive change in the country." "With this, while lakhs of students will be able to study in their own language, many doors of opportunities will...open for them," PM Modi added.

276.title: We're demonstrating real democracy: Venugopal on Cong chief poll
276.article_body: Speaking about the Congress Presidential poll, party leader KC Venugopal on Monday said it's a moment of pride for the entire Congress that the party is in a democratic process to elect the Congress President. "We're demonstrating real democracy. Nobody will be rubber stamp President," he added. "It's only Congress that can elect party President," Venugopal stated.

277.title: Uttarakhand CM meets Indian Ambassadors to 7 countries in Dehradun
277.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami met seven Indian Ambassadors at his Dehradun residence and discussed promotion of the "One District Two Products" scheme. "More efforts are needed to make people aware of the local products of Uttarakhand in different countries...Uttarakhand has many possibilities in the fields of tourism, industry and horticulture," said Dhami.

278.title: Armed robbers enter Delhi-Kolkata Duronto Express, loot passengers at gunpoint
278.article_body: Some miscreants entered the Delhi-Kolkata Duronto Express on Sunday and looted some passengers of their valuables at gunpoint in Bihar, reports said. Reports added that the miscreants barged into the train and snatched chains from passengers. The passengers then lodged a complaint with the Government Railway Police. An FIR has been registered.

279.title: Gujarat govt cuts VAT on CNG & PNG by 10%; to give 2 free LPG cylinders
279.article_body: Gujarat government on Monday announced that it has cut value-added tax (VAT) on CNG and PNG by 10%. As a result of the VAT-cut, consumers using CNG will benefit by ₹6-7/kg while those using PNG will benefit by ₹5-6/kg. The government has also announced that two free LPG cylinders will be given to beneficiaries of Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY).

280.title: LJP (Ram Vilas) to contest Gujarat, Himachal Pradesh polls: Paswan
280.article_body: LJP (Ram Vilas) President Chirag Paswan has confirmed that the party will be contesting the upcoming Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls. However, the party is yet to take a decision on the number of seats it will contest in the elections. Voting for the Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls will be held in a single phase on November 12.

281.title: Comparing Sisodia, Jain with Bhagat Singh unfortunate: Punjab Cong chief
281.article_body: Punjab Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja Warring criticised AAP national convenor and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal for comparing party leaders Manish Sisodia and Satyendar Jain with freedom fighter Bhagat Singh, terming it "unfortunate". "It is not right to compare anyone with Bhagat Singh…No individual can ever match the sacrifice and commitment of Shaheed-e-Azam Bhagat Singh Ji," Warring added.

282.title: Shooting in US' Pittsburgh leaves 3 people dead, 1 injured
282.article_body: Three people, including two women, were killed and one man was injured following a shooting incident in US' Pittsburgh, authorities said. The injured man, who arrived at a hospital, had a gunshot wound to the leg and is in stable condition, a Pittsburgh Public Safety spokesperson said. The incident occurred near a busy intersection around 10 pm, officials said.

283.title: Sikandar Raza smashes highest-ever score by a Zimbabwe batter in T20 World Cup history
283.article_body: Zimbabwe middle-order batter Sikandar Raza on Monday created history by smashing the highest-ever score by a Zimbabwe batter in the history of T20 World Cup. The 36-year-old scored 82(48) against Ireland to set the record. The previous record was held by Brendan Taylor, who had smashed 60*(45) against Australia in T20 World Cup 2007.

284.title: Kejriwal should keep his anxiety in check, worst yet to come: Malviya
284.article_body: BJP leader Amit Malviya on Monday said that Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal is behaving like a "schizophrenic" and tweeting incessantly about Deputy CM Manish Sisodia. "He should keep his anxiety in check because the worst is perhaps still to come," Malviya tweeted. Sisodia on Monday reached the CBI headquarters for questioning in Delhi excise policy case.

285.title: Sajid Khan asked my breast size, frequency of sex: Bhojpuri actress Rani Chatterjee
285.article_body: Bhojpuri actress Rani Chatterjee has accused Sajid Khan of sexual harassment. Rani said Sajid invited her to his house and told her she will be wearing a short lehenga in an item song and asked her to show her legs, which she did. According to her, Sajid then asked her about her breast size and about the frequency of intercourse.

286.title: AAP raises 'Jab Modi darta hai police ko aage karta hai' slogan against summon to Sisodia
286.article_body: After CBI summoned AAP leader and Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia in the Delhi excise policy scam, the party workers protested against the BJP-led central government. Videos from the protest site showed AAP workers attacking PM Narendra Modi and sloganeering, "Jab jab Modi darta hai, police ko aage karta hai." Earlier, AAP had said that CBI would arrest Sisodia today.

287.title: Dharmendra is definitely the most handsome man I've met: Hema Malini
287.article_body: Actress-politician Hema Malini said her husband Dharmendra is "definitely the most handsome man" she's ever met. "That's why I married him. I guess we do make a beautiful couple," said Hema, who recently turned 74. Talking about her birthday wish, Hema said, "Dharamji and I should remain healthy" and added that their fans' love "is like oxygen" for their souls.

288.title: One of my most difficult characters: Tabu on 'Drishyam 2'
288.article_body: Actress Tabu said her 'Drishyam 2' character is one of her "most difficult" roles. "I must give credit for writing this character. It's very unusual for writers to write such a complex character," she added. Tabu reprises her role as Meera Deshmukh in the Abhishek Pathak directorial, which is the Hindi remake of the Malayalam film with the same title.

289.title: Nitish is 'master' in Bihar govt, rest are rubber stamps: RJD leader
289.article_body: Former Bihar Agriculture Minister, Sudhakar Singh, said that Nitish Kumar is the "master" in the state government and the rest are "mere rubber stamps". He said that the CM avoided the issues that he raised because votes are cast based on caste lines and not pressing issues. The government's decision to provide 10 lakh jobs is a "jumla".

290.title: It took 7 months to rewrite 'Drishyam 2', made a lot of changes: Director
290.article_body: Director Abhishek Pathak revealed that there are a lot of changes in Ajay Devgn-starrer 'Drishyam 2', which is the remake of a Malayalam film of the same name. "We took 7 months to rewrite the film," he added. Meanwhile, Ajay said the film has been treated in a different manner, adding that audiences will feel it's a "fresh film".

291.title: It's an adventure story: Vijayendra on Mahesh Babu & Rajamouli's film
291.article_body: SS Rajamouli's father and writer KV Vijayendra Prasad has said that the 'Baahubali' director and Mahesh Babu's film is an adventure story. When asked if the film will be inspired by real-life events, Vijayendra replied, "Yes, you can write it." He further revealed that the film will roll out next year. Rajamouli had recently directed 'RRR', which featured Jr NTR.

292.title: Kanye West to buy right-wing social media app Parler
292.article_body: Kanye West is buying the right-wing social media app Parler, which has been banned by Apple and Google multiple times and was used to coordinate the January 6 Capitol riot. The rapper, known as Ye, said, "In a world where conservative opinions are considered to be controversial we have to make sure we have the right to freely express ourselves."

293.title: Anil performs with Norwegian dance group Quick Style, fans react
293.article_body: Anil Kapoor recently performed with 'Quick Style', a Norwegian dance group whose performance on the song 'Kala Chashma' went viral. The actor and the dance group performed on the song 'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha'. Reacting to the video on Instagram, a fan wrote, "The collaboration we all needed," while another commented, "Best thing on the internet today."

294.title: Good outing: Suryakumar on India's 6-run win vs Aus in T20 WC warm-up match
294.article_body: Following India's six-run win against Australia in T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up match in Brisbane, India batter Suryakumar Yadav took to Twitter and wrote, "Good outing." Suryakumar scored 50 runs off 33 balls. Put to bat first, India scored 186/7 in 20 overs. Opener KL Rahul top-scored for India with a 33-ball 57.

295.title: Underpass work on Greater Noida's Kisan Chowk to begin soon: Official
295.article_body: The Greater Noida authority will soon start construction work on an underpass proposed at the Kisan Chowk. The decision has been taken to address the traffic congestion in the area. "We hope that the DPR [of the underpass] is prepared in the next two-three months, paving way for construction work to begin at the site," an official said.

296.title: We learnt we need to be clinical towards the end: Finch after defeat vs India
296.article_body: With Australia losing six wickets in the last two overs while chasing India's 187-run target in their warm-up match, Australia captain Aaron Finch said, "We learnt that we need to be clinical towards the back-end." Finch added, "We did drag them back after that blistering start from KL Rahul." Rahul scored 57 off 33 balls in the match.

297.title: 14-month-old girl falls into bucket of water, dies in Haryana
297.article_body: A 14-month-old girl died after she allegedly fell into a bucket filled with water in a village in Haryana's Rohtak. The girl's father had gone for work and her mother was also not present at home when the incident took place, according to the police. An ASI said that the girl had gone into the bathroom where bucket was kept.

298.title: Man kills wife & kids in Hyd, neighbours alert police after sensing foul smell
298.article_body: A man killed his wife and two kids, aged seven and 11, with a scissor and later killed himself in Hyderabad. The police found the bodies on Monday, three days after the incident took place, following complaints by the neighbours about a foul smell coming from the house. Police are trying to ascertain if the accused had any mental illness.

299.title: Delhi's Safdarjung Hospital submits ₹1,200 cr plan to build facilities
299.article_body: Delhi's Safdarjung Hospital has submitted a fresh proposal to the Centre worth ₹1,200 crore to build maternity and childcare wing and hostels on its campus, officials said. The proposal was submitted again following a delay in construction due to coronavirus pandemic, Medical Superintendent Dr BL Sherwal said. Hostel project will start next year after getting Centre's approval, Sherwal added.

300.title: 22-yr-old Galgotias University student who was found dead in drain had drowned: Police
300.article_body: The 22-year-old Galgotias University student who was found dead in a drain a few days ago had drowned, Noida Police said citing his post-mortem report. Yashasvi Raj, a second-year BSc Agriculture student, had been missing since October 12. His family members had alleged that five students killed him after a fight. There were no apparent injuries on the body.

301.title: Youth tied to scooter, dragged on streets for not paying borrowed money in Odisha
301.article_body: A youth was tied to a scooter and dragged on the busy streets in Odisha's Cuttack for non-payment of borrowed money, police said. A video of the incident went viral on social media. Police have detained two people in connection with the case. Police said that the victim has also been identified.

302.title: Engine oil entering air-conditioning system caused smoke in SpiceJet Hyd flight: DGCA
302.article_body: After the Goa-Hyderabad SpiceJet flight made an emergency landing due to smoke in its cabin, DGCA said it was a result of the engine oil entering the aircraft's air-conditioning system. The DGCA also ordered SpiceJet to send all oil samples to Pratt & Whitney Canada every 15 days to ensure no metal or carbon seal components are present in them.

303.title: Want Rahul to stop Bharat Jodo Yatra, focus on poll-bound states: Cong MP
303.article_body: Congress MP Francisco Sardinha on Monday said he wants party leader Rahul Gandhi to stop the Bharat Jodo Yatra and focus on poll-bound Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat to "awaken the public" so that "they vote for the only party that can defeat BJP". "The only party that can be an Opposition to BJP is Congress," Sardinha added.

304.title: Wanted drug trafficker arrested with mephedrone worth ₹1 lakh in Pune
304.article_body: The Anti Narcotics Cell of the Pune City Police have arrested a 35-year-old wanted drug peddler identified as Asif Patel. Police have seized around six grams of mephedrone, estimated to be worth ₹1 lakh, and 0.6 grams of liquid ecstasy (MDMA) from his possession. Reportedly, Patel was wanted by the police for a past offence of mephedrone trafficking.

305.title: Man slips while travelling on local train's footboard in Mumbai; video surfaces
305.article_body: A video showing a man falling off from a crowded local train in Mumbai has gone viral. It can be seen in the video that the man lost balance from footboard of the local train he was travelling in and fell on the railway station's platform. However, he manages to save himself from potential mishap and stands up after falling.

306.title: Man who vandalised cars at DCW chief's house sings '4 Botal Vodka' at police station
306.article_body: The man who broke into Delhi Commission for Women's (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal's house and vandalised cars was seen singing 'Chaar Botal Vodka' at a police station after being held. A video has surfaced online showing him dressed inappropriately and dancing while singing the song. Earlier, Maliwal shared pictures of the damaged cars at her residence.

307.title: Bezos family to donate $710.5 mn to cancer centre in US' Seattle
307.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos' family has announced that they would donate $710.5 million over the next decade to Fred Hutchinson Cancer Centre in US' Seattle. The donation will fund recruitment of 36 new researchers, construction of a new 3.9 lakh-square-foot research building and expansion of immunotherapy research. It'll also fund expansion of institution-wide clinical research capabilities.

308.title: Vaishali Takkar was going to marry US-based software engineer in December, reveal friends
308.article_body: Late actress Vaishali Takkar's friends, actor Vikas Sethi and his wife Jhanvi Rana, have revealed that she was set to get married to a software engineer based out of California in December. "She told me that she was coming to Mumbai post-Diwali for her wedding shopping," said Jhanvi. The 29-year-old actress died by suicide on Sunday.

309.title: World no. 1 Iga Swiatek wins 8th title of 2022 at San Diego Open
309.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek won her eighth title of the year, defeating qualifier Donna Vekic 6-3, 3-6, 6-0 in San Diego Open final. It was the 21-year-old's 64th match win of the year, the most since Serena Williams' 78 in 2013. Overall, it was Swiatek's 11th WTA singles title. Swiatek has lost only one final in 2022.

310.title: I never asked for my departure in January: Mbappe on PSG exit rumours
310.article_body: Reacting to the recent reports claiming that he wants to leave PSG during the next transfer window, striker Kylian Mbappe said he's very happy at the club and he's not involved in the rumours "directly or indirectly". He added, "I never asked for my departure in January...I was as shocked by this news as everyone else...it's completely false."

311.title: Firecrackers worth ₹6 cr seized during raids in Bihar ahead of Diwali
311.article_body: Firecrackers worth ₹6 crore were seized during raids at 13 locations across Bihar ahead of Diwali. All of them procured huge consignments without proper documents and tax payments under the goods and services tax (GST). The raids were carried out on Saturday and Sunday. The raids were also conducted in Patna.

312.title: Virat Kohli takes one-handed flying catch against Australia, video goes viral
312.article_body: A video has gone viral showing ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli taking a one-handed flying catch to dismiss Australia pacer Pat Cummins off Mohammad Shami during their T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up match on Monday. Kohli took the catch while fielding at long on. India defeated Australia by six runs after taking four wickets on the last four deliveries.

313.title: Crux of 'Salaar' is very much between Prabhas & my characters: Prithviraj
313.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Prithviraj Sukumaran said Salaar's "crux" revolves around his and Prabhas' characters. Prithviraj, who plays Vardharaja Mannaar in the film, said he's glad that he said yes to 'Salaar' as it "might just be one of those epic cinematic experiences". "I deem it a privilege that somebody like Prashanth Neel...thought it was worth waiting for me," he added.

314.title: Delhi Dy CM Sisodia seeks mother's blessings before CBI questioning
314.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia sought his mother's blessings before appearing for CBI questioning in his alleged involvement in the Delhi excise policy scam. AAP shared images of Sisodia meeting his mother on the party's official Twitter handle saying, "Whoever has his mother's blessings, has the hand of God on his head."

315.title: Japan PM orders probe into Unification Church after Abe's killing
315.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida on Monday ordered an investigation into the Unification Church after ties between it and lawmakers of the ruling Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) surfaced following Shinzo Abe's assassination. Abe's suspected killer blamed the ex-PM for endorsing the group, accusing it of leading his mother to bankruptcy. Critics call the church a cult that relies on dubious fund-raising.

316.title: Sensational in all 3 departments, India look ready for T20 WC: Uthappa
316.article_body: After India's win in the T20 World Cup warm-up match against Australia, ex-cricketer Robin Uthappa said 'Men in Blue' looking ready for the T20 World Cup. "Lethal bowling by Shami...Brilliant piece of fielding by Virat and terrific batting from Rahul and Suryakumar! Sensational in all three departments," tweeted Uthappa. India defeated Australia by six runs in the warm-up match.

317.title: We know how lethal he is: Rohit on Shami's 3/4 vs Aus in T20 WC warm-up match
317.article_body: Discussing pacer Mohammad Shami's spell of 3/4 in India's T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up match against Australia, Rohit Sharma said, "We know how lethal he can be." "We wanted to give him a challenge and let him bowl the final over," added Rohit. Shami picked three wickets in the 20th over, helping India beat Australia by six runs.

318.title: BBMP commissioner conducts on-site inspections to check pothole repair works
318.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's (BBMP) Chief Commissioner conducted a joint inspection of various civic projects going on in Bengaluru's East zone, including filling of potholes. He reviewed the works and asked the officials to clear roads at the earliest. Earlier this month, Karnataka HC warned BBMP of punitive orders against civic officials for not completing pothole repair works.

319.title: Mumbai records highest rainfall in Oct in 10 yrs, yellow alert issued for Oct 17-18
319.article_body: Mumbai's Santacruz Observatory has recorded 216 mm of rainfall so far in October, the highest in a decade. Mumbai had received 197.7 mm of rainfall in October 2012, while the average rainfall the city receives during October is around 91 mm. The India Meteorological Department has also issued a 'yellow' alert for Mumbai for October 17-18.

320.title: Rahul Gandhi casts vote at Bharat Jodo Yatra campsite in Karnataka
320.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday cast his vote to elect the next party President at Bharat Jodo Yatra campsite in Karnataka's Ballari. Meanwhile, Congress chief Sonia Gandhi, along with party leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, cast her vote for the next party chief in Delhi. The results will be declared on October 19.

321.title: An extremely vulnerable day: Prateik on Smita Patil's birth anniversary
321.article_body: Actor Prateik Babbar said his late mother and veteran actress Smita Patil's birth anniversary is "an extremely vulnerable" day for him. Remembering Patil on her 67th birth anniversary, Babbar said the actress "was always loved" by people and he wants to "carry forward that emotion". "I feel extremely blessed and humbled with all the wishes that pour in," he added.

322.title: Only got 'we want to slap you' feedback: Navika on 'English Vinglish'
322.article_body: Navika Kotia, who played Sridevi's daughter in 'English Vinglish', revealed that she didn't get any offer from Bollywood after the film, adding, "I only got...we-want-to-slap-you feedback." "Till date, when people realise I played Sridevi's daughter, they tell me 'I felt like slapping you'," she added. "I take it as a compliment because...I was supposed to trigger people in...film," said Navika.

323.title: Accident averted as truck rolls backwards on Mumbai-Pune Expressway
323.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a truck loaded with iron roads moving backwards reportedly after its brake failed on Mumbai-Pune Expressway near Lonavala. However, the driver of the heavy-sized vehicle managed to take control of it amidst brake failure, thus averting a major accident. The driver of the vehicle has been identified as Shitafi.

324.title: BTS members to serve in the military, band to reunite in 2025
324.article_body: All seven members of the K-pop boy band BTS will go off on mandatory military service, their agency said on Monday. They are looking forward to reconvening as a group again around 2025. Notably, all able-bodied males aged 18 to 28 in South Korea are required to serve in the military for about two years to guard against North Korea.

325.title: Targeted killings will never stop until justice is served: Farooq Abdullah
325.article_body: NC chief Farooq Abdullah claimed that incidents of targeted killings by terrorists in J&K are not going to stop until justice is served. "Earlier, they said such killings were happening due to Article 370, but it's abrogated now, so why such killings haven't stopped? Who's responsible?" Abdullah said. Earlier on Saturday, a Kashmiri Pandit was killed by militants in Shopian.

326.title: 44-yr-old passes obscene remarks at 16-yr-old Thane schoolgirl
326.article_body: A 44-year-old man was arrested for passing obscene remarks at a 16-year-old schoolgirl in Thane, a police official said on Sunday. The victim, a class 10 student, was returning after writing an exam on Saturday morning when the incident took place, the official added. The accused worked at a showroom and was pinned down by a civic security guard.

327.title: Request PM to allow Sourav Ganguly to contest ICC election: Mamata
327.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee appealed to PM Narendra Modi that Sourav Ganguly must be allowed to contest ICC election. "He's a popular figure which is why he is being deprived," Mamata said. "Request the Government of India not to take a decision politically, but for cricket, sports," she added. Nominations for ICC election will be filed on October 20.

328.title: We demand restoration of statehood for J&K: Ghulam Nabi Azad
328.article_body: Democratic Azad Party chief Ghulam Nabi Azad demanded the restoration of statehood for Jammu and Kashmir ahead of the Assembly elections, which will be held next year. "We have three main agendas. First to restore statehood, second to reserve rights to purchase lands for J&K people only and third to reserve jobs for local youth," said Azad.

329.title: 18-yr-old tuition teacher gang-raped in UP's Lucknow
329.article_body: An 18-year-old tuition teacher was allegedly gang-raped after she had boarded an auto-rickshaw to reach her home in Lucknow, UP. The victim was allegedly raped by the auto-rickshaw driver and one other passenger, police said. The accused have been identified and efforts are on to arrest them, police added. The victim had taken the auto-rickshaw from Kathauta crossing.

330.title: Nokia wins multi-year deal to supply 5G hardware to Reliance Jio
330.article_body: Nokia announced that it has signed a multi-year contract with Reliance Jio to supply 5G Radio Access Network (RAN) hardware across the nation. According to a press filing, Nokia will supply equipment from its AirScale portfolio, including base stations, high-capacity 5G Massive MIMO antennas, and Remote Radio Heads (RRH) to support different spectrum bands, and self-organizing network software.

331.title: Aditya Birla Capital receives nod to bid for Reliance Nippon Life Insurance
331.article_body: The Committee of Creditors (CoC) of Reliance Capital has approved a proposal by Aditya Birla Capital to bid for Reliance Nippon Life Insurance Company. The approval would accelerate Reliance Capital's ongoing bankruptcy process. A valuer appointed by the administrator for Reliance Capital's insolvency proceedings had estimated the embedded value of the life insurance company at ₹5,800 crore.

332.title: Fire breaks out at sports store in Pune; no one injured
332.article_body: A fire broke out at a sports store in the Deccan Gymkhana area in Pune on Monday. Five vehicles reached the spot and brought the blaze under control in around an hour. No one was injured in the incident. A police team has been deployed in the area to control the traffic situation and the crowd.

333.title: Pro-democracy protester pulled into Chinese consulate, beaten in UK
333.article_body: A pro-democracy protester was dragged into the Chinese consulate and allegedly assaulted in UK's Manchester before being rescued by police officers who entered the compound. The incident occurred when a group of people protested outside the consulate on Sunday against the 20th National Congress of the Chinese Communist Party. A video and pictures of the incident have surfaced online.

334.title: Hema Malini & I were never friends, 'Seeta...' was offered to me: Mumtaz
334.article_body: Actress Mumtaz said she was never friends with Hema Malini. "We were pitted against one another, so there was always a tension between us," she added. Mumtaz stated there were films she could not do, which Hema did and there were films that Hema could not do, which she did. She said 'Seeta Aur Geeta' was first offered to her.

335.title: Haven't seen captain who knows best time to attack after Dhoni: Misbah
335.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Misbah Ul Haq said he hasn't seen a captain who knows the best time to attack the opposition after MS Dhoni. "Captains these days don't do it much...You have to take a chance," added Misbah. "Mahela Jayawardena and Stephen Fleming...knew the batter's psyche and how to make their strength a weakness," he stated.

336.title: Sisodia raising slogans as if AAP won ‘World Cup in corruption’: BJP
336.article_body: BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra on Monday said that AAP's Manish Sisodia was raising slogans in the car while going to the CBI office as if the party "had won the world cup on corruption". He added, "AAP is the biggest gimmick party. It was formed to fight corruption and its leaders turned out to be diehard corrupt."

337.title: Sealed iPhone from 2007 sells for $39,000 at auction, over 60 times its original price
337.article_body: An unopened first-generation iPhone from 2007 was auctioned for $39,339.60 by US-based LCG Auctions. When it was first released, the phone was priced at $499 to $599 and has now fetched over 60 times that price at the auction. The unused 8GB iPhone came with a 3.5-inch screen, a 2-megapixel camera, and a web browser.

338.title: Bombay HC grants bail to rape accused, asks him to marry untraceable victim within a year
338.article_body: The Bombay High Court granted bail to a 26-year-old man arrested in a rape case, setting a condition he'd have to marry the victim, who's currently untraceable, if she's found within a year. The court said the accused and the woman were in consensual relationship, but rape case was registered when he started avoiding her after learning she was pregnant.

339.title: Bar owner attacked in Pune for not serving liquor on credit
339.article_body: Owner of a bar in Pune's Narhe was allegedly attacked with a sharp object by five to seven people for denying them liquor on credit. The accused also damaged a computer and some kitchen equipment and when hotel staffers tried to intervene, the group threatened them and asked the other customers to leave the bar, according to the police complaint.

340.title: BJP won't contest Andheri East Assembly by-election: Maha BJP President
340.article_body: Maharashtra BJP President Chandrashekhar Bawankule has announced that the party will not contest Mumbai's Andheri East Assembly bypolls. Bawankule said that the party's candidate Murji Patel will withdraw the nomination. He made the announcement in Nagpur, reports said. "The BJP had previously also not contested some of the bypolls," he added.

341.title: Ola CEO asked a staffer to run 3 laps around the factory for a mistake: Report
341.article_body: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal asked a custodial manager to run three laps around the Ola Futurefactory in Tamil Nadu as a punishment, Bloomberg reported citing people who were present there at the time. Aggarwal had summoned the custodial manager after spotting a shuttered entryway that should have been left open. Ola claims Futurefactory is the world's largest two-wheeler factory.

342.title: Urvashi Rautela chops her hair in support of Iran's anti-hijab protests, shares pics
342.article_body: Urvashi Rautela has shared photos of herself getting her hair chopped in support of Iran's women protesters and Uttarakhand's Ankita Bhandari. The protests in Iran were prompted by the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini following her arrest for allegedly violating dress code. Meanwhile, Ankita Bhandari, a 19-year-old resort receptionist, was allegedly killed by an ex-BJP leader's son and two others.

343.title: Just Shami things: Jaffer on Aus losing 4 wickets off 4 balls vs India
343.article_body: Reacting to India pacer Mohammad Shami picking three wickets in the 20th over of India's T20 World Cup warm-up match against Australia on Monday, ex-cricketer Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Just Shami things." He added, "[Shami] joins the team late. Directly bowls the 20th over. Finishes with figures of 1-0-4-3. [India] win the game by six runs. Smiles."

344.title: Sanjay Singh, AAP leaders detained outside CBI HQ amid Manish Sisodia's questioning
344.article_body: Delhi Police detained all Aam Aadmi Party leaders and workers who were holding sit-in protest outside the CBI office during Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia's questioning on Monday. Reports said AAP leaders, workers and MLAs including Sanjay Singh, Rakhi Birla and Jarnail Singh have been detained. "Modi's police is dragging and harassing women and senior readers," Sanjay Singh said.

345.title: The underdogs are putting on a show: Uthappa after Scotland beat WI
345.article_body: Reacting to Scotland defeating two-time champions West Indies by 42 runs in T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India cricketer Robin Uthappa tweeted, "The underdogs are putting on a show." "These aren't just wins, these are statements," read a tweet from Wasim Jaffer. Namibia had earlier defeated eighth-ranked Sri Lanka by 55 runs in the first match of T20 World Cup 2022.

346.title: BYJU'S raises $250 million days after laying off 2,500 employees
346.article_body: BYJU'S, the world's most-valuable edtech startup, has raised $250 million in a new funding round. Existing investors participated in the round, including Qatar Investment Authority, the startup announced on Monday. The fundraise comes days after BYJU'S announced plans to lay off about 2,500 employees across departments. The layoffs are aimed at cutting costs amid the company's mounting losses.

347.title: SRK attends AbRam's Taekwondo match with Aryan & Suhana, pics surface
347.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan on Sunday, along with Aryan Khan and Suhana Khan, attended AbRam's Taekwondo match. The event, which was also attended by Gauri Khan, saw Shah Rukh presenting medals to the winners in some of the photos, which have gone viral on social media. The pictures feature SRK kissing AbRam and Kareena Kapoor Khan's son Taimur Ali Khan.

348.title: PM Modi inaugurates 'PM Kisan Samman Sammelan', releases ₹16,000 crore
348.article_body: PM Modi inaugurated the two-day "PM Kisan Samman Sammelan" event in New Delhi today. It aims to bring together more than 13,500 farmers from across the country and around 1,500 agri startups. He also released PM-Kisan funds worth ₹16,000 crore through Direct Benefit Transfer. More than 1 crore farmers from various institutions are expected to attend the event virtually.

349.title: Parents allegedly kill 2 kids then die by suicide in Hyd: Police
349.article_body: Four members of a family, including two children, were found dead at their house in Hyderabad's Chandanagar on Monday. Police said that the parents allegedly killed the children and then died by suicide. Locals had found the bodies after they broke into the house following complaints of a foul smell. Police suspect that the incident occurred due to family disputes.

350.title: Considering bringing Pant back would be going in wrong direction: Aakash
350.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra said India will be heading in the "wrong direction" by thinking of including Rishabh Pant in their lineup for T20 World Cup 2022 as a last-minute change. "Pant's been tested at the top-order...[and] middle-order but you don't know whether you want to play him," added Aakash. "India should...stick with [the] six batters...they've tried out recently," he stated.

351.title: It’s a privilege, it's my 1st time captaining my country at WC: Rohit
351.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma has said it's a privilege to captain the side in the T20 World Cup in Australia. "It's the first time in 15 years that I am captaining my country at a World Cup. We want to enjoy and have fun," he added. Rohit-led India defeated Australia by six runs in their warm-up match on Monday.

352.title: Even she's not safe: Kejriwal after DCW chief's house attacked in Delhi
352.article_body: After Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chairperson Swati Maliwal alleged that her house was attacked, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said that even she is not safe in the national capital.
