"The law and order situation in Delhi has become very bad...I hope that LG Sahib will also give some time to fix the law and order situation," he added.

353.title: Delhi's Asola Bhati Mines to have 4 artificial waterfalls by Oct-end: Report
353.article_body: As many as four artificial waterfalls and 10 floating fountains will come up in the Neeli Jheel at Delhi's Asola Bhati Mines by the end of October, reports said. The trial of the waterfalls and fountains is currently going on. Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena visited the site on Sunday and oversaw the trials.

354.title: Scotland record their biggest win in T20 WC history, defeat 2-time champions West Indies
354.article_body: Scotland defeated two-time champions West Indies by 42 runs in their first match of T20 World Cup 2022. It is Scotland's biggest win (by runs) in T20 World Cup history. Batting first, Scotland put up a total of 160/5, with opener George Munsey top-scoring with 66*(53). West Indies were bowled out for 118 in 18.3 overs.

355.title: Tesla shares fall 50% from record high, market cap drops to $642 bn
355.article_body: The shares of Tesla closed down 7.6% to $204.99 on Friday, marking a 50% drop from its all-time high. The stock had closed at a record high of $409.97 on November 4, 2021. The drop took Tesla's market capitalisation to $642 billion. It has reportedly lost about a third of its value in less than a month.

356.title: Pak batters stopped playing reverse lap shot after T20 WC 2007 final: Misbah
356.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Misbah Ul Haq said Pakistan's batters stopped playing reverse lap or sweep shots following his dismissal after playing a scoop shot, in the 2007 T20 World Cup final against India. "No one remembers the 15 fours that I played before [that] but everyone remembers that shot," added Misbah. India beat Pakistan in the final by five runs.

357.title: Old video of Sajid Khan talking about his engagement to Gauahar Khan goes viral
357.article_body: An old video of Sajid Khan admitting he was engaged to Gauahar Khan on Kiran Juneja's show has gone viral. Sajid said he was in a relationship with Gauahar for a year. He said, "Uss waqt mera character bohot dheela tha (In those days, I had a bad character). I used to go around with girls and lie to them."

358.title: Inciting chaos, terror: Iran Prez after US Prez supports protesters
358.article_body: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi has accused US President Joe Biden of inciting "chaos, terror and destruction in another country" through his comments, IRNA reported. This comes after Biden expressed his support for people protesting over Mahsa Amini's death. Biden should be "reminded of the eternal words of...founder of the Islamic Republic, who called America the great Satan", Raisi said.

359.title: 300 maar: Passenger to BMW driver in live video minutes before crash in UP
359.article_body: A live video, recorded from inside the BMW minutes before it collided with a truck on the Purvanchal Expressway on Friday, has surfaced online. One of the passengers can be heard telling the driver, "300 maar" (hit 300 kmph). The car was travelling at 230 kmph when it hit the truck, with the bodies of its occupants thrown nearby.

360.title: Thousands take to streets in protest over rising prices in Paris
360.article_body: Thousands of people marched on the streets in Paris on Sunday in a protest over rising prices. The leader of the left-wing political party La France Insoumise, Jean-Luc Melenchon, and this year's Nobel Prize winner for Literature, Annie Ernaux, were seen marching with the protesters. This comes as four unions called for strikes on Tuesday demanding an increase in wages.

361.title: India take 4 wickets on last 4 balls, defeat Australia by 6 runs in T20 WC warm-up match
361.article_body: India defeated Australia by six runs in their T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up match in Brisbane. Batting first, India posted a total of 186/7, with KL Rahul and Suryakumar Yadav smashing fifties. Australia were bowled out for 180 runs in 20 overs with India taking four wickets on the last four deliveries. Mohammad Shami registered bowling figures of 1-0-4-3.

362.title: Apple freezes plans to use China-based YMTC's chips: Report
362.article_body: Apple has frozen its plans to use memory chips from China's Yangtze Memory Technologies amid increasing political pressure, Nikkei Asia reported citing sources. Apple had originally planned to use YMTC's NAND flash memory chips as early as 2022. The US has added YMTC and 30 other firms to a list of companies that it has been unable to inspect.

363.title: Waiting for a long time for this: Sonia on Cong Presidential poll
363.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Monday cast her vote in Delhi to elect the new party President. "I have been waiting for a long time for this thing," she said. Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra also accompanied her mother Sonia Gandhi and cast her vote. Voting for the Congress Presidential poll began at 10 am today.

364.title: Shah Rukh Khan shoots race sequence for 'Dunki' with 500 people: Report
364.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan has reportedly shot a race sequence in Mumbai for the Rajkumar Hirani directorial film, 'Dunki'. As per a report, over 500 people gathered for the scene, which was reportedly shot from 6 am to 8 am on Sunday. Apart from Shah Rukh, the scene will reportedly also feature actor Boman Irani.

365.title: Police raid Gurugram warehouse, find over 4,000 kg banned firecrackers
365.article_body: Police raided a warehouse in Gurugram and recovered banned firecrackers weighing 4,235 kilograms, reports said. Reports added that an FIR has been registered against the godown owner who is a native of Delhi. Police said that the matter is being investigated and that the owner of the warehouse will be arrested soon.

366.title: DCW chief Swati says someone broke into her house, vandalised cars; shares pics
366.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women's (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal has said that someone broke into her house on Monday. The person vandalised two cars belonging to Maliwal and her mother, she said, adding that they were not home at the time of attack. Sharing pictures of the damaged cars on Twitter, Maliwal wrote, "Whatever you do, I will not be afraid."

367.title: Shaheen Afridi, Fakhar Zaman join Pak squad for T20 WC, PCB shares video
367.article_body: Pakistan pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi and middle-order batter Fakhar Zaman joined their squad in Brisbane on Sunday for the T20 World Cup in Australia. Both players were in rehab after suffering knee injuries in recent months. Shaheen hurt his knee during a Test against Sri Lanka in July, while Fakhar suffered the injury in the Asia Cup final last month.

368.title: Did not violate guidelines for Congress' presidential polls: Gehlot
368.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has claimed that he did not violate the guidelines for the Congress' presidential elections by seeking votes for candidate Mallikarjun Kharge. "I am Kharge's proposer. Some people created controversy that I campaigned in his support...What I did was in the role of a proposer...I did not violate the election process," said Gehlot.

369.title: I believe Cong’s revival has begun: Tharoor on party's Presidential poll
369.article_body: As voting for the Congress Presidential election began at 10 am today, party leader Shashi Tharoor said, "I believe the revival of Congress has begun." Furthermore, he added, "Today I spoke to Mr Kharge and said whatever has happened, we remain colleagues and friends." Tharoor stated that the fate of the Congress party is in the hands of party workers.

370.title: Will withdraw cases against agitators if we win Gujarat polls: Kejriwal
370.article_body: While addressing a public gathering in Gujarat's Bhavnagar, AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal promised to withdraw cases against various movement leaders within 15 days of the formation of the government. "Now people are looking for a new engine to run the government. They are no more interested in double-engine government, as claimed by the BJP," said Kejriwal.

371.title: People should never fear air turbulence, says Musk; Twitter users react
371.article_body: Responding to a video showing aeroplane wings during turbulence, Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "People should never fear turbulence. Commercial airliner wings can handle insane amounts of bending." Commenting on his tweet, a user wrote, "Musk is absolutely right here."  Meanwhile, another tweeted, "It's not always safe for the people inside."

372.title: AAP should stop doing 'pressure politics': BJP over CBI summon to Sisodia
372.article_body: BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia on Sunday said AAP should stop doing "pressure politics" after the CBI summoned Deputy CM Manish Sisodia for questioning in Delhi excise policy case. "If you're so scared of probe agencies, then you should not have indulged in corruption. Sisodia is less a Deputy CM and more a corrupt collection agent of Kejriwal," he added.

373.title: Don't want to believe this: Actress Muskan on Vaishali Takkar's death
373.article_body: Actress Muskan Bamne mourned Vaishali Takkar's death and said she doesn't want to believe the news of her passing away. "You were always there for me and treated me like your younger sister. I'll miss you a lot," Muskan wrote in an Instagram post. Muskan played Vaishali's younger sister in the television series 'Super Sisters - Chalega Pyar Ka Jaadu'.

374.title: Sonia Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi cast vote to elect new Congress President
374.article_body: Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi and General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi cast their vote at AICC office in Delhi to elect the new party president. "I have been waiting for a long time for this thing," Sonia said after casting her vote. Meanwhile, Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said that Congress is the only political party to hold elections for its president.

375.title: We're hoping that pacers do well in T20 WC, other teams have belief: Karim
375.article_body: Talking about the T20 World Cup 2022, ex-selector Saba Karim said, "There is a difference between hope and belief. Other teams have...belief that the...pacers in their ranks will bowl well." "We, on the other hand, are hoping that the likes of Mohammad Shami and Bhuvneshwar Kumar...bowl well," added Karim. "Our death bowling is a big issue," Karim had earlier stated.

376.title: Sisodia reaches CBI headquarters, says 'Plan is to arrest me, keep me out of Gujarat'
376.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday morning reached the CBI headquarters for questioning in the Delhi excise policy case and predicted his arrest. "Their (BJP) aim is to send me to jail to stop me from going to Gujarat. Nothing was found against me in the raids," stated Sisodia. "BJP is scared because...[they're] losing Gujarat," he had earlier tweeted.

377.title: Suspected break failure causes Maharashtra bus to hit 8 vehicles, 5 injured
377.article_body: Five people were injured after a Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation bus hit at least eight vehicles after a suspected brake failure on Mumbai-Bengaluru Highway. Reports said that those injured were taken to hospital and are out of danger. Reports added that investigators will probe the bus, following which, the exact reason for the failure of brakes will be ascertained.

378.title: Cyberabad Police help candidates who reach wrong exam centres, share pics
378.article_body: Cyberabad Police on Sunday said that its traffic police personnel helped candidates, who're appearing for the Telangana State Public Service Commission Group-1 preliminary examination, after they reached the wrong exam centres by mistake. The police also shared pictures of the traffic police personnel on its Twitter handle, adding that the candidates were escorted to the right centre on time.

379.title: Hair Care Juice reduces 93% of our users' hair fall in 2 months: Kapiva
379.article_body: Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda reveals that nutrition is essential in combating hair loss & promoting new hair growth. Kapiva's Hair Care Juice is a potent formulation of Noni, Bhringraj, Ashwagandha & Amla that stimulates scalp's bloodstream & effectively strengthens hair follicles than external treatments, Kapiva said. Furthermore, 70% of users experienced faster & newer hair growth, it added.

380.title: Chennai man gifts cars, bikes worth ₹1.2 crore to staff, says 'They helped me earn profits'
380.article_body: A Chennai-based jewellery shop owner has presented cars and bikes worth ₹1.2 crore to his employees as gifts for Diwali. Jayanthi Lal Chayanthi, the owner of Challani Jewellery, gifted eight cars and 18 bikes to his staff and colleagues. "This is to encourage their work...They've worked with me in all ups and downs...and helped me earn profits," Jayanthi Lal said.

381.title: Pune may receive rainfall with thunderstorms till October 19: IMD
381.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted intense rainfall along with thunderstorms and lightning in Pune till October 19, which may disrupt Diwali shopping plans for many. Anupam Kashyapi, head of the weather forecasting division, IMD, Pune, said that there may be a further delay in the withdrawal of monsoon from the southern parts of Maharashtra.

382.title: Winds favouring AAP, people of Gujarat have decided to oust BJP: Punjab CM
382.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said that the people of Gujarat have made up their minds to give a mandate to AAP and oust the BJP from power. He further added that the winds of change are blowing in the favour of AAP. He claimed that the BJP is responsible for plundering the wealth of the people.

383.title: 76 butterfly species spotted across 7 biodiversity parks in Delhi
383.article_body: A total of 76 different butterfly species have been recorded across Delhi's seven biodiversity parks during a week-long 'butterfly assessment week'. The Aravalli Biodiversity Park (ABP) in Vasant Vihar reported the highest number of species (68), followed by the Kamla Nehru Ridge with 59 different species, according to officials. Last year, 71 different species were spotted during the census.

384.title: Ukraine says Russia attacked capital Kyiv with kamikaze drones, video surfaces
384.article_body: At least three explosions have been heard in the Ukrainian capital Kyiv on Monday as Andriy Yermak, head of President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's office, said the attacks were from kamikaze drones. Mayor Vitali Klitschko said residential buildings in central Shevchenkivskiy area had been damaged. Social media posts showed a fire in the area of the apparent strike, with black smoke rising.

385.title: Varun Dhawan shares first look of 'Bhediya'
385.article_body: Varun Dhawan shared the first look of his upcoming film 'Bhediya', which will feature him as a werewolf. Sharing the poster, Varun announced that the trailer of the Amar Kaushik directorial will release on October 19. 'Bhediya', which also stars Kriti Sanon, Deepak Dobriyal and Abhishek Banerjee, marks the third project in Maddock Films' horror-comedy genre, following 'Stree' and 'Roohi'.

386.title: Suryakumar heard saying 'Maarne ka mood nahi ho raha hai' on stump mic, gets out next ball
386.article_body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav was heard saying "Maarne ka mood nahi ho raha hai" after reaching his fifty off 32 deliveries against Australia in the T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up match. A video of the same has gone viral. Suryakumar got out the next ball after making the remark. India posted a total of 186/7 in their 20 overs.

387.title: It has a GoT kind of feel, says Rohit Sharma on press conference room; ICC shares video
387.article_body: Talking about the room where the press conference for all the 16 captains at T20 World Cup 2022 was held, Team India captain Rohit Sharma said, "It's pretty cool actually, just a 'Game of Thrones' kind of feel." The ICC then shared a video showing moments from the press conference with 'Game of Thrones' theme song in the background.

388.title: BJP is true well-wisher of Muslims: UP Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak
388.article_body: UP Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak on Sunday said that the BJP is a true well-wisher of Muslims and it is making meaningful efforts to bring them to the mainstream. "So-called secular parties used Muslims only as a vote bank," Pathak added. "These parties came into power by taking the votes of Muslims but they never got their rights," he stated.

389.title: Selena Gomez, Hailey Bieber pose together at Academy Museum Gala, fans react
389.article_body: Amid feud rumours, Selena Gomez and Hailey Bieber were seen posing together at the recently held 2022 Academy Museum Gala. Photographer Tyrell Hampton shared their picture, which went viral on social media platforms and received reactions from their fans. A fan wrote, "World peace has been found", while another comment read, "This post will go down in history".

390.title: I don't look at non-striker, it's waste of energy: Cummins on 'mankading'
390.article_body: Australia Test captain Pat Cummins has termed 'mankading' as a "waste of energy", stating that he never looks at the non-striker during his run-up. Cummins, however, also added, "I think [mankading is] transitioning from something that was maybe frowned upon to something that is considered just a run out." He further said, "I'm not sure every bowler will [attempt mankading]."

391.title: Over 42 lakh pilgrims visited Char Dham in 2022, 311 died since May: Report
391.article_body: Over 42 lakh pilgrims have visited the Char Dham this year, reports said. Reports added that out of the total, 311 pilgrims have died since the yatra started in May this year. So far, 15.14 lakh pilgrims have visited Badrinath, 14.25 lakh have visited Kedarnath, 6 lakh have visited Gangotri and more than 4.73 lakh have visited Yamunotri.

392.title: Haven't had intimate relationship since becoming single mother: Drew Barrymore
392.article_body: Drew Barrymore shared that she hasn't been able to have an intimate relationship after "entering life as a single mom". However, she said she's not someone "who needs sex and has to go out there and engage with people on that level". "A relationship with a man hasn't been top of my mind for a very long time," she added.

393.title: 54 buildings declared dangerous in Mumbai's Borivali, 33 razed
393.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has declared 54 buildings in Borivali's R (central) ward 'dilapidated' and 'dangerous' as per its C1 category of classifying structures. Out of the total, 33 buildings have been demolished, while three more will be demolished after Diwali. The BMC said that it is awaiting court clearance for the demolition of 13 other dilapidated buildings.

394.title: Drake, The Weeknd to boycott Grammy Awards for second consecutive year
394.article_body: Drake and The Weeknd have decided to boycott the Grammy Awards 2023 for the second year in a row and have refused to submit their work to the Recording Academy. The Canadian artists have previously shared their concerns about how things work with the organisation behind the award ceremony. Grammy Awards 2023 nominations will be announced on November 15.

395.title: Whatever we said to each other was on friendly note: Kharge on Tharoor
395.article_body: With the voting underway for the Congress Presidential elections, Mallikarjun Kharge, who is contesting against Shashi Tharoor, said whatever was said before the poll was on a friendly note. "It's a part of our internal election...Tharoor telephoned me and wished me luck and I also said the same," added Kharge. The results are likely to be declared on October 19.

396.title: Pakistani security forces shoot dead 5 militants in Balochistan
396.article_body: Pakistani security forces shot dead five militants in the Mastung area of Balochistan province on Sunday. According to security officials, the operation targeted militants who were linked to a bomb blast that took place in the area, which left three people dead and six others injured. Some security officials were also injured in the operation, counterterrorism police said.

397.title: 16-year-old Indian Grandmaster Gukesh D becomes youngest to beat world champion Carlsen
397.article_body: India's 16-year-old Grandmaster Gukesh D created history by becoming the youngest chess player to beat Magnus Carlsen after he became the world champion. Gukesh achieved the feat by defeating the world number one in the ninth round of Aimchess Rapid. Earlier in the tournament, India's 19-year-old Grandmaster Arjun Erigaisi had defeated Carlsen.

398.title: Meta's Horizon Worlds failing targets, most users not returning after 1st month: Report
398.article_body: Meta's Horizon Worlds is failing to meet internal performance expectations, according to a report. Internal documents revealed that while 5,00,000 monthly active users were expected on Horizon Worlds by the end of the year, the current figure is less than 2,00,000. The report also said that most users didn't return to Horizon after the first month on the platform.

399.title: Voting begins to elect Congress' next chief between Mallikarjun Kharge & Shashi Tharoor
399.article_body: Voting for the Congress presidential elections began at 10 am today. The fate of the Congress party will be decided by over 9,000 Pradesh Congress Committee delegates who comprise the electoral college for electing the next party chief between Mallikarjun Kharge and Shashi Tharoor. Sonia Gandhi and Manmohan Singh will vote in Delhi, while Rahul Gandhi will vote in Karnataka.

400.title: India reports 2,060 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 26,834
400.article_body: India reported 2,060 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The active cases in India now stand at 26,834. The data showed that 1,841 people recovered in the last 24 hours. The recovery rate in the country currently stands at 98.75%. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached  5,28,905.

401.title: Activists set off fire alarm to disrupt German Chancellor's speech
401.article_body: Environmentalist group, Scientist Rebellion, said on Sunday that its activists set off the fire alarm to interrupt German Chancellor Olaf Scholz's speech at World Health Summit in Berlin. It added that this was done to "draw particular attention to the climate failure of the German government". Some of the group's members also glued their hands to the ground in protest.
